gitHubText:
### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

I noticed whilst putting together an example set of configuration for tenants that currently there is a exception when trying to assign members in configuration, which is:
```
Caused by: org.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: failed to lazily initialize a collection of role: io.camunda.identity.entity.AccessRule.tenants: could not initialize proxy - no Session
```

Looking at it I can see that the code fails when we try to retrieve the tenants for the access rule that we want to assign a member to, frustratingly we have tests for this behaviour but it seems that the Hibernate session is extending to allow the tests to pass...

Having [read a little about the options to resolve this](https://www.baeldung.com/hibernate-initialize-proxy-exception) I decided to opt for the `JOIN FETCH` approach as mentioned [here](https://www.baeldung.com/hibernate-initialize-proxy-exception#4-using-join-fetching) because using `FetchType.EAGER` is generally discouraged.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] Code changes are covered by tests
- [x] Design review requested or not required


 Infra-connect: Successfully created backport PR for `v8.3`:
- #2183
title: fix: resolve lazy loading issue with tenants linked to access rules

gitHubText:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In our Elasticsearch Exporter we support management of index lifecycles with ILM. OpenSearch provides a similar mechanic called ISM. In other to keep the exporters aligned and fully support OpenSearch we should add support for ISM to our OpenSearch Exporter.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Users should be able to configure ISM similar to how ILM works. The solution must support both OpenSearch 1.3.x and 2.8.x

This also should be documented in the [OpenSearch Exporter docs](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/self-managed/zeebe-deployment/exporters/opensearch-exporter/)!

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Not implementing this. Users could do it through the OpenSearch UI. It is less convenient and an extra burden on users. It would also mean we'd provide more feature in our Elasticsearch Exporter than our OpenSearch Exporter.

**Additional context**
N/A
title: Support Index State Management in OpenSearch exporter

gitHubText:
### Description

The Zeebe Gateway supports handling tenant-aware `BroadcastSignal` RPC calls.


```[tasklist]
### AC
- [x] `BroadcastSignal` RPC requests and responses contain a `tenantId` property.
- [x] Signal-related records contain a `tenantId` property.
- [x] `BroadcastSignal` requests are validated for correct a `tenantId` .
```
title: Gateway supports multi-tenancy in signal broadcast RPCs

gitHubText:
### Description

The Java client provides a `BroadcastSignalCommand` for broadcasting tenant-aware signals in Zeebe. These commands should support multi-tenancy by exposing an optional `tenantId` property/method.

The following error codes may be returned:
* PERMISSION_DENIED (code: 7) 
   * when a user attempts to broadcast a signal of a tenant they are not authorized for, when multi-tenancy is enabled.
* INVALID_ARGUMENT (code: 3)
   * For a provided tenant id, when multi-tenancy is disabled
   * For a missing tenant id, when multi-tenancy is enabled
   * For an invalid tenant id (i.e. doesn't match the pre-defined format), when multi-tenancy is enabled.
title: Java client supports multi-tenancy for BroadcastSignal RPC

gitHubText:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently Forms are received from the state without using any caching mechanism. Adding a caching for recently retrieved Forms will increase the performance of retrieval. We do a similar implementation for Decision and Process resources in their `DbState` classes as well.

Since deploying forms to Zeebe is a feature that is introduced in 8.3, there is no such requirement or problems with performance at the moment. Therefore, this issue is just an performance improvement at the moment.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add caching mechanism to DbFormState as already done for Decision and Process states.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The alternative is basically not using caching at all and that is already implemented.

**Additional context**
EPIC link: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/12874
title: Use caching for Forms

title: Support multi-tenancy for Resource Deletion

title: Support deletion of the Forms through DeleteResource gRPC

gitHubText:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
As described in the issue #13410, we want to keep track of event types that triggered elements in Grafana. This is not possible without actually adding them to the job metric in the Engine.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Update `ProcessEngineMetrics` class to event types for `element_instance_events_total` metric. Then, update their usages for activated/completed/terminated element instances.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
As long as we want to show these metrics in Grafana, there is no a real alternative than keeping track of this metric in the Engine.

 korthout: Alternative solution, we can add another label to the [`element_instance_events_total` metric](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/main/engine/src/main/java/io/camunda/zeebe/engine/metrics/ProcessEngineMetrics.java#L55-L61) to track `eventType`. (size: x-small)
 korthout: I'd propose to pick this up soon, so we can unblock #13410, which can help us troubleshoot issues faster and more easily.
title: Keep track of event types in the Engine

gitHubText:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In the past weeks, there was a support case where it reports that the Engine is lagging behind while process new records. The incident was resolved afterwards. The incident was caused by a timer catch event that keeps generating multiple new records, so that the thread pool was busy with generating new records.

While investigating in Grafana, the team were able to observe a catch event was taking the CPU time but cannot see which type of catch event was causing the issue. Therefore, cannot root cause the issue without looking at other log resources.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The type of events should be added to Grafana `General Overview -> Current Events` view. Every element instance should contains its own type

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Alternative way to achieve the same goal is to look at export logs which takes more time and less accessible than Grafana.

**Additional context**
It is more precise if we have activation, completion and termination information of catch events in the view.


 korthout: Marking this as `upcoming` as it can help us troubleshoot problems faster and more easily.

It is blocked by:
- #13433
title: Indicate the type of activated/completed/terminated catch events in Grafana

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug**

After restoring from backup, some partitions encountered [following error](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;cursorTimestamp=2023-09-26T11:26:03.072149905Z;endTime=2023-09-26T11:56:36.088Z;pinnedLogId=2023-09-26T11:26:01.585896295Z%2Fh1uykcs15coafgsq;query=logName:%22stdout%22%0Aresource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.container_name%3D%22zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%22eab43606-a898-467f-967f-21a757fc69b7-zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22europe-west1%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22camunda-saas-int-chaos%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22worker-chaos-1%22%0Aresource.labels.pod_name%3D%22zeebe-1%22%0AjsonPayload.context.partitionId%3D%2226%22%0Atimestamp%3D%222023-09-26T11:26:01.585896295Z%22%0AinsertId%3D%22h1uykcs15coafgsq%22;startTime=2023-09-26T10:56:36.088Z;summaryFields=jsonPayload%252Fcontext%252FpartitionId,resource%252Flabels%252Fpod_name:false:32:beginning?project=camunda-saas-int-chaos).

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Expected to delete index after 3982, but it is lower than the commit index 3983. Deleting committed entries can lead to inconsistencies and is prohibited.
	at io.atomix.raft.storage.log.RaftLog.deleteAfter(RaftLog.java:168) ~[zeebe-atomix-cluster-8.2.13.jar:8.2.13]
	at io.atomix.raft.roles.PassiveRole.tryToAppend(PassiveRole.java:565) ~[zeebe-atomix-cluster-8.2.13.jar:8.2.13]
	at io.atomix.raft.roles.PassiveRole.appendEntries(PassiveRole.java:511) ~[zeebe-atomix-cluster-8.2.13.jar:8.2.13]
	at io.atomix.raft.roles.PassiveRole.handleAppend(PassiveRole.java:367) ~[zeebe-atomix-cluster-8.2.13.jar:8.2.13]
```

What happened:

First Zeebe-1 votes for Zeebe-2 and Zeebe-2 becomes leader.
```
INFO 2023-09-26T11:25:57.870482436Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26}{role=FOLLOWER} - Accepted PollRequest{term=0, candidate=2, lastLogIndex=3982, lastLogTerm=2}: candidate's log is up-to-date
INFO 2023-09-26T11:25:57.887139637Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26}{role=FOLLOWER} - Accepted VoteRequest{term=1, candidate=2, lastLogIndex=3982, lastLogTerm=2}: candidate's log is up-to-date
INFO 2023-09-26T11:25:57.892834402Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26} - Found leader 2
```
See above. `term` is 1, but the lastLogTerm is 2. This is because after restore, raft metastore is empty. So it restarts the term from 1. This is ok so far. But after Zeebe-2 becomes the leader and commits its InitialEntry at index `3983`, Zeebe-0 starts election probably because it did not receive any heartbeat from the leader `Zeebe-2`.

```
INFO 2023-09-26T11:26:01.569385207Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26}{role=FOLLOWER} - Accepted PollRequest{term=1, candidate=0, lastLogIndex=3982, lastLogTerm=2}: candidate's log is up-to-date
INFO 2023-09-26T11:26:01.577404370Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26}{role=FOLLOWER} - Accepted VoteRequest{term=2, candidate=0, lastLogIndex=3982, lastLogTerm=2}: candidate's log is up-to-date
INFO 2023-09-26T11:26:01.582069421Z [jsonPayload.context.partitionId: 26] [resource.labels.podName: zeebe-1] RaftServer{raft-partition-partition-26} - Found leader 0
```
Zeebe-1 accepts poll request from Zeebe-0 because Zeebe-0's lastLogTerm > Zeebe-1's current term 1. This leads to inconsistency. 

**Impact**
If it happens immediately after restore before writing any new data, it should be safe to restart the brokers. Due to the above error, the new leader Zeebe-0 cannot commit anything. So, as a result there won't be any actual data inconsistency. If we wait until all nodes are healthy before restarting the traffic to the cluster, this will not lead to any actual data inconsistency because no user requests has been processed yet. However, if there are new user data that has been processed, then there is a possibility for partial data loss. **Note that the data recovered from the backup won't be lost if this happens. Only new data will be affected.**

**To Reproduce**

Following scenario can lead to this error:
1. A, B, C restored from the same backup, where the term of the last entry in the log is > 1
2. A, B forms the quorum and A became the leader
3. A and B committed new entries 
4. C does not know about the new leader. So it starts new election.

**Expected behavior**

After, restoring from a backup raft can continue working in all scenarios.

**Environment:**
- Zeebe Version: Observed in 8.2.13

Relates to [https://jira.camunda.com/browse/SUPPORT-19174](https://jira.camunda.com/browse/SUPPORT-19174)


 nicpuppa: This affect also a SM customer ([support case](https://jira.camunda.com/browse/SUPPORT-19174)). In this case the problem was with `term`. Since it is reset, no new snapshots can be taken until the term increases to a higher value than the one before the backup. As a result, logs are not compacted and disk usage grows high.

Fixed by this [PR](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/pull/15272)
title: Potential inconsistency in raft after restoring from a backup

gitHubText:
## Description

When we delete a process definition we have a check that looks for any running process instances that belong to the definition. If there is any, the command gets rejected and we don't allow the deletion to happen.

The check doesn't keep in mind that there could be banned instances. As a result, a definition with banned instances is always rejected. What's worse is that the check only happens for the partition which receives the command. As a result the command could be accepted on the receiving partition, but keeps getting rejected on other partition where there may be a banned instance.

## Impact
**Scenario 1**
A user is unable to delete a process definition because there is a banned instance which causes the command to be rejected.

**Scenario 2**
A user deletes a process definition. The command is accepted and distributed. The partition that it gets distributed to has a banned instance. As a result it will never send an acknowledgment. The distributing partition will retry the command distribution indefinitely. This will happen every 5 minutes.
In the meantime users will still be able to start new instances for the process definition. However, this will be flaky as the definition is deleted on some partitions, but not on others. There is a state inconsistency until this bug is resolved.
title: Deleting a process definition only checks running instances and doesn't ignore banned instances

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug**

The constructor of the `ActivateJobsCommandImpl` is trying to set the `workerName` during construction and expects the `config.getDefaultJobWorkerName())` to be non null. This leads to a `NullPointerException` as the underlying builder doesnt support a null value. This is an issue as clients are able to set the `workerName` using the builder pattern after constructing the command.

```
public ActivateJobsCommandImpl(
      final GatewayStub asyncStub,
      final ZeebeClientConfiguration config,
      final JsonMapper jsonMapper,
      final Predicate<Throwable> retryPredicate) {
    this.asyncStub = asyncStub;
    this.jsonMapper = jsonMapper;
    this.retryPredicate = retryPredicate;
    builder = ActivateJobsRequest.newBuilder();
    requestTimeout(config.getDefaultRequestTimeout());
    timeout(config.getDefaultJobTimeout());
    workerName(config.getDefaultJobWorkerName());
  }
```

**To Reproduce**

Create an implementation of the `ZeebeClientProperties` that returns `null` for the `getDefaultJobWorkerName`

**Expected behavior**

The builder should fallback to the default worker name only if it wasnt set by a client when constructing the final command.

**Log/Stacktrace**

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at io.camunda.zeebe.gateway.protocol.GatewayOuterClass$ActivateJobsRequest$Builder.setWorker(GatewayOuterClass.java:2169)
	at io.camunda.zeebe.client.impl.command.ActivateJobsCommandImpl.workerName(ActivateJobsCommandImpl.java:83)
	at io.camunda.zeebe.client.impl.command.ActivateJobsCommandImpl.<init>(ActivateJobsCommandImpl.java:60)
```

**Environment:**
- Zeebe Version:8.3.0-alpha4

Looks like it happens as the command builder is used instead of the previously used request builder since: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/commit/359a402b5bbee7247749385a458c5b3f3aba7e78

 korthout: @npepinpe This sounds like a regression introduced with #12888. Could you please have a look?
 npepinpe: We had a look together, and AFAIK this is the same behavior as ever. We were always calling `workerName` in the constructor of the command, and it makes sense to me to follow Simon's suggestion and only apply defaults in the build method, not in the constructor.

EDIT: here's the commit which introduced setting the worker name as the default configuration: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/06f4e463efd3ca1be67056660f12abd4ad7867d8/clients/java/src/main/java/io/zeebe/client/impl/job/ActivateJobsCommandImpl.java#L46

That's from 2018, so it looks to me like this was always the behavior. The only thing I can imagine would be that _maybe_ the gRPC behavior changed, where they simply don't allow null values anymore, but I doubt it. I suspect if we check, it was always like this.
 npepinpe: > Looks like it happens as the command builder is used instead of the previously used request builder since: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/commit/359a402b5bbee7247749385a458c5b3f3aba7e78

@sbuettner - can you point out to me where the change from request to command builder happened? From the commit, the code is the same - we extracted an interface out of a class, but the implementation was not changed.

For example, in the "old" implementation:

```java
    final ActivateJobsCommandStep3 activateCommand =
        jobClient
            .newActivateJobsCommand()
            .jobType(jobType)
            .maxJobsToActivate(maxJobsToActivate)
            .timeout(timeout)
            .workerName(workerName);
```

And it was simply moved in the "new" one, but remains the same:

```java
    final ActivateJobsCommandStep3 activateCommand =
        jobClient
            .newActivateJobsCommand()
            .jobType(jobType)
            .maxJobsToActivate(maxJobsToActivate)
            .timeout(timeout)
            .workerName(workerName);
```

I'm also not sure what you mean by request vs command builder :thinking: 
 sbuettner: @npepinpe It looks like it was changed here: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/commit/11c548dd4d46f62119a600da0dc1abad7231c417#diff-7101968ae21254c317a1606e4a1969ec3864b538403541ecc7161351b2bd38ddL86
 npepinpe: Good catch! Seems unrelated to job push, but it is indeed a regression in that sense for 8.3.0. I'll defer to the ZPA team on what the priority for it is.
 korthout: Thanks @npepinpe and @sbuettner for the extra input.

- We'll need to fix this before 8.3 as it regressed recently.
- We consider this mid severity, as a workaround is available (don't set null as the default job worker name)
- We wonder how quickly a user would run into this, do you have to set `null` explicitly, or does it also occur when the client doesn't define any default?
- This would change the impact dramatically, and so our priority
- We want to timebox whether that is the case
- It might be worth it to fix immediately then (but please timebox it)
title: ActivateJobsCommandImpl throws NullPointerException when ZeebeClientProperties.getDefaultJobWorkerName is null

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug**

In CW42 and CW43, we have a massive UDP resource leak which causes UDP listening connections to eventually max out, such that no new ones can be created. This causes widespread DNS failures, eventually leading to out of disk space as we cannot export data anymore.

I can confirm this is not happening in 8.3.1 or prior versions.

**To Reproduce**

In any of the pods in CW42 and CW43, run `watch -n1 -- 'wc -l /proc/net/udp'`, and you will see the amount of open UDP connections is constantly increasing, all coming from the Java process.

A quick `netstat -ulpne` gives little more information.

**Expected behavior**

The only open UDP connections are our Netty unicast service and temporary ones, meaning we should have a baseline of 2, and possibly transient ones that do not remain.

**Environment:**
- Zeebe Version: 8.4.0-SNAPSHOT CW42 and CW43
title: UDP resource leaks

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug**

It would seem aggregate of job streams is failing on the gateway due to our usage of `ArrayProperty` (and underlying `ArrayValue`). The implementation of `equals` and `hashCode` for these is not consistent since it relies on the last modification being reflected in their internal buffer, which is not always the case.

**To Reproduce**

Start a cluster of one gateway, one broker. Create two job streams/workers with the exact same parameters. You will see two client streams on the gateway - which is correct - but each will have a different server stream ID, which is incorrect.

**Expected behavior**

Logically equivalent client streams are aggregated on the gateway.
title: Job streams not aggregated correctly on gateway

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug**

In one benchmark, I ran into an issue where two brokers out of three had no job streams registered, and only one broker was aware of them.

However, the gateway actuator shows that they think all streams are connected to all brokers, which is incorrect.

One interesting thing is the gateway did not aggregate the streams at all, treating each client as a different server stream.

**To Reproduce**

Not sure why this happened. Could be related to #14624 I suppose, but likely not.

**Expected behavior**

Gateway and broker stream states are consistent.

**Environment:**
- Zeebe Version: 8.3.0+


 npepinpe: It seems the member was not restarted, but it was locally removed/re-added, yet the streams were not recreated. This is an issue we thought was fixed, but apparently isn't.
 npepinpe: Yeah, we didn't send a restart streams request to the gateway when it rejoined, so this is clearly broken.
title: Job streams not registered on broker after some time

gitHubText:
**Describe the bug** During startup of the broker Zeebe encounters snapshot 0. Likely an indication of some corruption. We encountered this before on prod. The solution was to delete the partition data and restart the broker. After this the broker recovers. When we first found it https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/14486 was created. This was released in 8.3.0. However, today it occurred again on 8.3.0. **To Reproduce** Unclear, but it's probably hard to do as you'd need to introduce some corruption. **Expected behavior** It is handled more gracefully and doesn't prevent the broker from reaching a bootloop. **Log/Stacktrace**
Full Stacktrace

``` java.lang.IllegalStateException: In partition 1 expected to find a snapshot at index >= log's first index 30443521, but found snapshot 0. A previous snapshot is most likely corrupted. at io.atomix.raft.utils.StateUtil.verifySnapshotLogConsistent ( io/atomix.raft.utils/StateUtil.java:33 ) at io.atomix.raft.impl.RaftContext. ( io/atomix.raft.impl/RaftContext.java:223 ) at io.atomix.raft.impl.DefaultRaftServer$Builder.build ( io/atomix.raft.impl/DefaultRaftServer.java:242 ) at io.atomix.raft.impl.DefaultRaftServer$Builder.build ( io/atomix.raft.impl/DefaultRaftServer.java:216 ) at io.atomix.raft.partition.impl.RaftPartitionServer.buildServer ( io/atomix.raft.partition.impl/RaftPartitionServer.java:159 ) at io.atomix.raft.partition.impl.RaftPartitionServer. ( io/atomix.raft.partition.impl/RaftPartitionServer.java:91 ) at io.atomix.raft.partition.RaftPartition.createServer ( io/atomix.raft.partition/RaftPartition.java:127 ) at io.atomix.raft.partition.RaftPartition.initServer ( io/atomix.raft.partition/RaftPartition.java:110 ) at io.atomix.raft.partition.RaftPartition.bootstrap ( io/atomix.raft.partition/RaftPartition.java:94 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.broker.partitioning.startup.steps.RaftBootstrapStep.startup ( io/camunda.zeebe.broker.partitioning.startup.steps/RaftBootstrapStep.java:31 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.broker.partitioning.startup.steps.RaftBootstrapStep.startup ( io/camunda.zeebe.broker.partitioning.startup.steps/RaftBootstrapStep.java:14 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.startup.StartupProcess.proceedWithStartupSynchronized ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler.startup/StartupProcess.java:161 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.startup.StartupProcess.lambda$proceedWithStartupSynchronized$3 ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler.startup/StartupProcess.java:169 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.future.FutureContinuationRunnable.run ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler.future/FutureContinuationRunnable.java:28 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorJob.invoke ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorJob.java:94 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorJob.execute ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorJob.java:45 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorTask.execute ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorTask.java:119 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorThread.executeCurrentTask ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorThread.java:130 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorThread.doWork ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorThread.java:108 ) at io.camunda.zeebe.scheduler.ActorThread.run ( io/camunda.zeebe.scheduler/ActorThread.java:227 ) ```

**Environment:** - OS: SaaS - Zeebe Version: 8.3.0 https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=logName:%22stdout%22%0Aresource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22camunda-saas-int-chaos%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%22f2275ddc-b3a0-44b4-bc8a-cdfc242514f1-zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22europe-west1%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22worker-chaos-1%22%0Aresource.labels.container_name%3D%22zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.pod_name%3D%22zeebe-0%22;pinnedLogId=2023-10-12T12:31:31.413159098Z%2Fa7opurgfpm3zpxtj;cursorTimestamp=2023-10-12T12:53:35.349727194Z;duration=PT3H?project=camunda-saas-int-chaos oleschoenburg: Since this is not fixed by https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/14486 we need to investigate this! npepinpe: Did anyone check what was on disk? Did we save the "corrupted" snapshot? Or is 0 assumed to mean there is no snapshot? deepthidevaki: related #14594 rodrigo-lourenco-lopes: This issue also happened again in a trial cluster also with the 8.3.0 version. [Alert](https://camunda.slack.com/archives/C04D5HLFP24/p1697503341553379), [Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22camunda-cloud-240911%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22us-central1%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22prod-worker-3%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%2236891658-b31b-4efa-bbbc-7dbef6acec10-zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.pod_name%3D%22zeebe-2%22%0Aresource.labels.container_name%3D%22zeebe%22%0A;pinnedLogId=2023-10-17T06:45:28.130308499Z%2Fldkhiotcmp0x0y7s;cursorTimestamp=2023-10-17T06:45:28.213227478Z;duration=PT12H?project=camunda-cloud-240911). Zelldon: Happened again. Was not able to connect to the failing pod (with debug container I had not access to the filesystem) had to delete the PVC and pod: ``` k delete pvc data-zeebe-2 & k delete pod zeebe-2 ``` npepinpe: Thinking out loud... Immediate hypothesis: the broker was shutdown right before this happened, without apparent error (so graceful shutdown). We already have a regression where we delete pending snapshots concurrently, outside of the snapshot store actor. What if we had been persisting the snapshot (on the actor) while the Raft partition was shutting down (thus deleting pending snapshots on the Raft thread)? Hm, I don't think that's possible actually, since the Raft thread waits for the persist operation to finish before doing anything else... So the changes we did to snapshot: - No integrity check after the move - if the move is not done completely, then the snapshot may be corrupted. - However, we only write the checksum file once the move is done, so if the node crashed during the move we would have no checksum file and would not consider the snapshot persisted. npepinpe: It's currently happening on a cluster, so I had a chance to look at the data. I've uploaded the partition's snapshot directory here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/10cMGw7QPepM5euTNl3tWfuaLHVnuQ5YI/view?usp=share_link The snapshot itself looks fine. But we can see the checksum file is completely empty :scream: npepinpe: Hm, this happened right after this bug: https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/14776 I wonder if it's not related. We open the checksum file, but crash before we can write. The file now exists, but it's empty. Oops. npepinpe: And also `FileOutputStream#flush` does nothing :tada:
title: IllegalStateException: found snapshot 0. A previous snapshot is most likely corrupted
Regular OOM when replicating large state due to messaging timeouts

Observed following error in release-8-3-0 benchmark.

Expected to process record 'TypedRecordImpl{metadata=RecordMetadata{recordType=COMMAND, valueType=PROCESS_INSTANCE_CREATION, intent=CREATE, authorization=JWT.xxxxxxxx.}, value={"bpmnProcessId":"benchmark","processDefinitionKey":2251799813685253,"processInstanceKey":2251799855211562,"version":1,"variables":".....}' without errors, but exception occurred with message 'Unable to determine string type, found unknown header byte 0x3e at reader offset 0'.

This error was logged for repeatedly for a couple of seconds. After that it didn't occur again. Occured in broker on two partitions around the same time.


**Log/Stacktrace**

[link to logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/errors/detail/CM_M__nUjKW63wE;service=zeebe;time=P7D?project=zeebe-io)
[logs.zip](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/files/12827812/downloaded-logs-20231006-08.zip)

 deepthidevaki: There are more errors similar to this https://console.cloud.google.com/errors;service=zeebe;version=release-8-3-0;time=PT6H;resolution=OPEN?project=zeebe-io 
 remcowesterhoud: I also see a lot of `failed to push job` and `failed to push payload` warnings. Looking at the dashboard there's 70+ banned instances. We must find out where this is coming from and resolve it asap.
 deepthidevaki: The pods also encountered SIGSEGV. Looks like it is also caused when reading msgpack.
[error.log](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/files/12828385/error.log)

 remcowesterhoud: After root-causing I've lowered the severity from `critical` to `high`. This is because this issue only occurs when job push is enabled, which is an experimental api. Because of this we can fix this in a patch release.

**Root-cause**
The problem lies in the job streamer. This is an object that only exists once per broker. This instance is shared between the partition on the broker. If a broker is leader for more than 1 partition, iterating through the tenants in the `JobActivationPropertiesImpl` will fail, as the ArrayProperty is not thread-safe.

**Quick-fix**
We can clone [the job activation properties in the `BpmnJobActivationBehavior`](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/main/engine/src/main/java/io/camunda/zeebe/engine/processing/bpmn/behavior/BpmnJobActivationBehavior.java#L67-L70), before we get the list of tenants. Because we have a copy we'll no longer have multiple partitions iterating over the same `ArrayProperty`.

**Nicer fix**
The engine always assumes everything is single-threaded. This makes it very easy to make changes in the engine. The job streamer is now the exception. If the broker can register streams per partition, instead of reusing the streamer we'll no longer have multiple partitions interacting with the same instance. This resolves the problem.
 npepinpe: Isn't the real issue that iterating over a supposedly immutable `ArrayProperty` actually mutates the object? :sweat_smile: The stream registry expects all its information to be immutable, so when `JobActivationPropertiesImpl` is, in fact, mutable, it's what causes the design dissonance.

I think almost all of us got bitten by the fact that iterating over an `ArrayValue` mutates the underlying object, which is (much like the Spanish inquisition) never what you expect. You can see so many of these objects where we clone the array property to a list or something before iterating for this specific reason. For example, `JobBatchRecord#getJobKeys`.

At any rate, I wouldn't propose registering streams per partition - it's just redundant work. Instead, you can wrap the given `JobStreamer` in a partition aware facade which can copy info when you need it.
 npepinpe: This came up in our planning - should I work on this? Will you work on this? If so, should I assume that, since it's in `ready`, it will be in the next 2 weeks?
 remcowesterhoud: Sorry, I put it in ready because we thought it was a critical issue and release blocker. We may have time for the quick-fix this week, but we have to prioritise documentation for the release. We want this to be part of 8.3.1 release.

We haven't decided yet on which approach we should take. If we have a separate job streamer for each partition I'd say it falls under ZDP responsibility. The quick-fix we can definitely do ourselves. Iterating over the ArrayProperty without mutating it sounds great too and would also be our responsibility.
 Zelldon: [Run into this issue as well when using cloud benchmark with SaaS cluster with v8.3.0](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22camunda-saas-prod%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22northamerica-northeast2%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22worker-5%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%222b3d50c8-e590-4eba-97d4-1da76e0d8fb4-zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.pod_name:%22zeebe-%22%0A-resource.labels.container_name%3D%22zeebe-analytics%22;pinnedLogId=2023-10-10T14:22:20.739210406Z%2Fbvjumarl3k64dbew;cursorTimestamp=2023-10-10T14:22:28.849604018Z;startTime=2023-10-10T13:24:40.544024Z;endTime=2023-10-10T15:24:40.544Z?project=camunda-saas-prod)

just want to highlight that this makes job push right now totally unusable.
 megglos: > We haven't decided yet on which approach we should take. If we have a separate job streamer for each partition I'd say it falls under ZDP responsibility. 

Imho, this sounds like a general change that would resolve the issue as a side-effect but the issue shouldn't be the reason for us to do it? Wdyt @npepinpe ?

> The quick-fix we can definitely do ourselves. Iterating over the ArrayProperty without mutating it sounds great too and would also be our responsibility.

Could you still do that this week so we have it ready for an upcoming 8.3.1 patch? Or do you need help with that? @remcowesterhoud

If medic week stays as quiet as today I'm sure I can find the time. If I get pulled in support cases I might not ðŸ¤·

**Describe the bug** There appears to be a race condition in the `PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker`. It can run concurrently to the stream processor, where the two access a shared in-memory state (aka transient state). Access to this state is threadsafe, but not spread over multiple calls. The race condition appears to exist here: The entries are first retrieved from the transient state, before we `get` the subscription from the persisted state. The transient state may have been modified before, leading to both states not being in-sync. https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/d928ba2ed6321b3e613320e9c7fcdd0bc0decc44/engine/src/main/java/io/camunda/zeebe/engine/state/message/DbMessageSubscriptionState.java#L229-L236 **To Reproduce** This may be hard to reproduce, as it's a race condition. It may be possible to set up by calling the associated method in a specific order where the order can be controlled. **Expected behavior** The checker should be able to run concurrently to the stream processor without issues. **Log/Stacktrace**
Full Stacktrace

``` java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "io.camunda.zeebe.engine.state.message.MessageSubscription.getRecord()" because "subscription" is null at io.camunda.zeebe.engine.processing.message.PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker.sendCommand(PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker.java:36) ~[zeebe-workflow-engine-8.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:8.3.0-SNAPSHOT] at io.camunda.zeebe.engine.state.message.DbMessageSubscriptionState.visitPending(DbMessageSubscriptionState.java:253) ~[zeebe-workflow-engine-8.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:8.3.0-SNAPSHOT] at io.camunda.zeebe.engine.processing.message.PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker.run(PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker.java:32) ~[zeebe-workflow-engine-8.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:8.3.0-SNAPSHOT] at io.camunda.zeebe.stream.api.scheduling.SimpleProcessingScheduleService.lambda$runAtFixedRate$0(SimpleProcessingScheduleService.java:35) ~[zeebe-stream-platform-8.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:8.3.0-SNAPSHOT] ```

[Link to log](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;cursorTimestamp=2023-10-02T13:01:28.455354092Z;endTime=2023-10-02T14:54:41.744537Z;query=error_group%2528%22CKOmuvKMwLOtvAE%22%2529%0AlogName:%22stdout%22%0Aresource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22camunda-saas-int-chaos%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22europe-west1%22%0Aresource.labels.container_name%3D%22zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22worker-chaos-1%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%2228dc004a-c9eb-4ee4-bd43-122d19470705-zeebe%22%0Aresource.labels.pod_name%3D%22zeebe-0%22%0Atimestamp%3D%222023-10-02T13:01:28.455354092Z%22%0AinsertId%3D%22t5z8oevltfufcaqu%22;startTime=2023-10-02T12:54:41.744Z?project=camunda-saas-int-chaos) korthout: We don't consider this to be a blocker for the 8.3.0 release. - The cluster recovered after the leader, that encountered the NPE, stepped down. The new leader did not run into the same race condition. - The race condition has already been around since 8.3.0-alpha3, and did not occur in our extensive testing. It's a rare occurrence. - Lastly, users that do run into this too often can disable the checker from running concurrently to stream processor by setting `zeebe.broker.processing.enableAsyncScheduledTasks: false`. This will completely mitigate this issue. Having said that, this issue is high severity as it disrupts regular processing, causing a drop in availability. korthout: It's possible that this is similar to this issue for timers: - https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/issues/13598 berkaycanbc: @korthout do you think we can move this one to ready so that it can be picked up? I can take a look at it. berkaycanbc: We can add a null check and log that subscription removed from the state if it is not found. Since message subscription record either correlated or deleted from the state, it should be safe to skip that record. WDYT? @korthout korthout: @berkaycanbc Sounds like a good plan. Feel free to pick it up. ðŸ‘ Please make sure to verify whether this race condition exists on previous versions (i.e. 8.2)
title: NPE in `PendingMessageSubscriptionChecker`

**Describe the bug** It looks like our current benchmark starter and worker don't work anymore with SaaS clusters. @hisImminence tried to use them for benchmarking cluster plans and ran into several issues. I was able to reproduce the same as well. We were only able to overcome this by using an old version. ``` image: gcr.io/zeebe-io/starter:8.1.8 ``` Would be great if we could fix this since we also need these applications for upcoming game days etc. **To Reproduce** 1. Create a cluster in SaaS 2. Setup [a cloud benchmark ](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/main/benchmarks/setup/newCloudBenchmark.sh) 3. Create credentials 4. Update the credentials file 5. Deploy benchmark via `make secret starter worker` 6. Observe Ask @hisImminence for more input **Expected behavior** The starter and worker can connect without issues. **Log/Stacktrace** See example [log](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Aresource.labels.project_id%3D%22zeebe-io%22%0Aresource.labels.location%3D%22europe-west1-b%22%0Aresource.labels.cluster_name%3D%22zeebe-cluster%22%0Aresource.labels.namespace_name%3D%22ck-immi-test%22%0Alabels.k8s-pod%2Fapp%3D%22starter%22;pinnedLogId=2023-08-29T13:10:00.033238529Z%2F103mjwp1vy2i8imu;cursorTimestamp=2023-08-29T13:10:00.033238529Z;startTime=2023-08-29T12:58:16.638597Z;endTime=2023-08-29T13:29:19.104Z?project=zeebe-io)

**Environment:** - Zeebe Version: SNAPSHOT? - Configuration: SaaS + benchmark apps Zelldon: BTW searching for that error it looks like we use HTTP instead of HTTPS? Did we changed anything in the clients in this regard? Might be an issue for the upcoming version, which we should check rather soon. Related findings: * https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/issues/2905#issuecomment-293625616 * https://stackoverflow.com/a/73515627/2165134 npepinpe: It looks like the client builder is fixed to use plaintext instead of properly connecting to SaaS. This you configure the worker/starter to use TLS or not? Zelldon: Before it just worked when setting the credentials, so this changed? npepinpe: From what I can tell, the benchmark apps haven't changed since 8.1.8, so maybe it's the client? :shrug: Did we use to enable TLS automatically if you had credentials maybe? I'd have to check. npepinpe: I'd be curious if you just tried setting the credentials/env vars, and then also the TLS application config if it works. Zelldon: > Did we use to enable TLS automatically if you had credentials maybe? I'd have to check. This is how it worked before afaik. npepinpe: While this may be a regression if that previous behavior has changed, I'm setting this as low severity since it's just a matter of properly configuring it. Could you confirm that with proper configuration it works @Zelldon ? If not, then we can treat it as higher severity. So for now I'm putting this in the backlog until then. Zelldon: TBH that is quite problematic, since it is totally unclear to the user what is the problem it took me quite a long time to understand and find the root cause. megglos: there is actually a config [for tls which is set to enabled](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/main/benchmarks/setup/cloud-default/starter.yaml#L26) I will check why it isn't used properly. This impacted QA when they wanted to make use of the benchmark for generating datasets.
title: Snapshot version of  benchmark application (starter/worker) doesn't work with SaaS

gitHubText:
## Description

Replaces `identity-sdk` by `identity-spring-boot-starter` which now takes care of handling all configuration options for `Identity`. This will provide the possibility to add new configuration options in Identity SDK without the need for any changes on the components side (f.e. in Operate).

The new `identity-spring-boot-starter` will provide the `Identity` and `IdentityConfiguration` beans if `Identity` is in classpath (used in the code). The beans will only be created if these are not created in your code.


Related to
## Related issues
- https://github.com/camunda/product-hub/issues/1849
- https://github.com/camunda-cloud/identity/issues/2162

Closes #https://github.com/camunda-cloud/identity/issues/2212

gitHubText:
## Description

We need to enable [enhanced security principles in our C8 docker images](https://github.com/camunda/product-hub/issues/717). We already made changes previously to use unprivileged user by default.

This PR:
- updates base image to alpine
- manually installs required java (needed because temurin alpine base image does support arm64)
- updates previous non-root user changes to work on alpine
- running on non-root fails as write access needed to `/tmp`. Following same approach as Zeebe and creating `/tmp` as a volume.

I [tested](https://github.com/camunda/operate/wiki/Test-custom-docker-images-in-cloud) locally (arm64, amd64), as well as on SaaS (created multi-arch image with generation using it). Seems to work but would prefer someone else also testing.

## Related issues
[Epic](https://github.com/camunda/product-hub/issues/717)

closes #4916, #5640

 johanwelgemoed: @jessesimpson36 Hope you don't mind if I added you to review as well from a distribution perspective.
 jessesimpson36: > @jessesimpson36 Hope you don't mind if I added you to review as well from a distribution perspective.

Sounds good. One thing I've noticed about this dockerfile, is that /usr/local/operate is owned by either root or 1000, and not by the user that we switch to (user id 1004).  This often becomes a problem when ZEEBE_CLIENT_CONFIG_PATH is not set, which means it uses the home directory by default.  But I get around that by creating a volume on /tmp and then setting ZEEBE_CLIENT_CONFIG_PATH to /tmp/randomfilepath .

In helm, everythings running in read-only mode, which means creating volumes is mandatory.   but our compose file in camunda-platform is not running in read-only mode, so it runs into permission issues on /usr/local/operate.

I created a image, and tested it myself and everything comes up fine. So I'm good with these changes :+1: 
 sdorokhova: @johanwelgemoed did you try to test the changes in any way? I see that Docker test is failing and branch is also not deploying. Could you please check this?
 johanwelgemoed: @sdorokhova How I tested it was
1. locally via docker-compose running only Zeebe and Operate - both on OpenSearch and Elasticsearch
2. created and pushed a docker image to gcr.io an then created a cluster on Int to test there. Also seemed to work there
I di not test other than that
 sdorokhova: @johanwelgemoed that's great to hear! We still need to do smth with failing test (probably we can disable linting) and failing preview env. For the latter I asked Infra team: https://camunda.slack.com/archives/C5AHF1D8T/p1698675467584759
 johanwelgemoed: @sdorokhova Yeah I'd still feel a bit more comfortable if someone else could also test :)

## Description

This PR implements the basic layout and navigation for migration mode. No styling yet.

- Refactor `InstancesList`
- Add feature flag `IS_INSTANCE_MIGRATION_ENABLED`
- Add MigrationView component
- Add processInstanceMigrationStore

visual regression tests are failing because of the migrate button. They should pass when `IS_INSTANCE_MIGRATION_ENABLED` is false

## TODO
- [ ] set `IS_INSTANCE_MIGRATION_ENABLED` to false


## Related issues

related to #5728 

Implements following acceptance criteria: 

> Create view "instance migration"
> Add state to track which step is active
> Add navigation buttons (back / next / confirm, see designs)

## Description

For now we don't need any special migrations steps, only the "copy" (reindex) step. So some Plans are not used currently.

* Implement `ReindexPlan`, `ReindexWithQueryAndScriptPlan`, `FillPostImporterQueuePlan`
* Fixed index settings for Opensearch 
* Refactor ReindexIT to use the tests for Opensearch and Elasticsearch
* Removed `ReindexPlan::buildScript`

gitHubText:
## Description

* we calculate maximal values of sequence per partition based on how the sequence value is built in Zeebe
* when `RecordsReader` read empty batch for several times (configurable, 10 by default), we try to search by query:
```
rangeQuery(ImportPositionIndex.SEQUENCE)
            .gt(sequence)
            .lte(maxPossibleSequence))
        .size(batchSize)
```

## Related issues

closes #5154

gitHubText:
## Description

Add a null check before using the index during post-import. An exception will be thrown if the index value is null.

Moved the common logic from ElasticsearchIncidentPostImportAction and OpensearchPostImportAction into a base class. This will be the start of some refactoring to allow for unit tests to be written for these classes.

gitHubText:
## Description

This PR fixes the mixpanel events by adjusting our CSP headers.

This can be tested in cloud, because we need to have mixpanel enabled.

Testing steps:

- Open cookie preferences from the user menu
![Screenshot 2023-10-12 at 15 27 00](https://github.com/camunda/operate/assets/45518829/ce29e1b3-cd2a-405f-93b9-cb613a728267)
- Enable `Analytics` then click `Save`
![Screenshot 2023-10-12 at 15 27 44](https://github.com/camunda/operate/assets/45518829/bbcf21a3-cee7-4f47-8779-4ac958005361)
- Open Network panel and select `All`
- Refresh page
- Observe the events being sent:
- 
![Screenshot 2023-10-12 at 16 25 49](https://github.com/camunda/operate/assets/45518829/8ad8bdc3-2503-4773-9246-9523ed82632c)

- To be safe, also observe Mixpanel website. 'Add token' event could be a nice candidate (go to modification mode in process instance detail page, select a flow node, add token to it)
- In a few minutes event should be visible here : https://eu.mixpanel.com/project/2665743/view/3203023/app/events#Y6fbUUsKZ79b
(please note that user id is demo here in the filters, you might need to adjust it to your user id that you are testing the mixpanel from)
![Screenshot 2023-10-12 at 16 29 56](https://github.com/camunda/operate/assets/45518829/8e9ff109-9a45-423e-8769-a9d2d93ba25d)

gitHubText:
<!-- Please link the related GitHub issue here -->

Closes #3545

## Description

This PR enhances the form retrieval process in the application. It updates the `getForm` method in both `FormStoreElasticSearch.java` and `FormStoreOpenSearch.java` to handle different scenarios of form retrieval based on form id, process definition id, and version. It also adds new methods to check if a form is associated with a task or a process. Additionally, it includes updates to the unit tests and integration tests to cover these new scenarios.

### Main Files Walkthrough

- **[els-schema/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/store/elasticsearch/FormStoreElasticSearch.java]**: The `getForm` method is updated to handle different scenarios of form retrieval based on form id, process definition id, and version. New methods `getFormEmbedded`, `getLinkedForm`, `isFormAssociatedToTask`, and `isFormAssociatedToProcess` are added to support these scenarios.
- **[els-schema/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/store/opensearch/FormStoreOpenSearch.java]**: Similar to `FormStoreElasticSearch.java`, the `getForm` method is updated and new methods are added to handle different scenarios of form retrieval.
- **[webapp/src/test/java/io/camunda/tasklist/webapp/api/rest/v1/controllers/FormControllerTest.java]**: New test cases are added to cover the different scenarios of form retrieval. These include getting an embedded form, getting a linked form when version is passed, and getting a linked form when version is not passed.
- **[webapp/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/webapp/api/rest/v1/controllers/FormController.java]**: The `getForm` method is updated to handle the optional `version` parameter. It also sets the `processDefinitionKey` when the form is deployed.
- **[els-schema/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/schema/templates/TaskTemplate.java]**: The `FORM_ID` and `PROCESS_DEFINITION_ID` fields are added to support the new form retrieval scenarios.
- **[els-schema/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/schema/indices/ProcessIndex.java]**: The `FORM_ID` and `ID` fields are added to support the new form retrieval scenarios.
- **[els-schema/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/store/FormStore.java]**: The `getForm` method signature is updated to include the `version` parameter.
- **[webapp/src/main/java/io/camunda/tasklist/webapp/graphql/query/FormQueryResolver.java]**: The `getForm` method is updated to handle the optional `version` parameter.
- **[els-schema/src/test/java/io/camunda/tasklist/store/elasticsearch/FormStoreElasticSearchTest.java]**: New test cases are added to cover the different scenarios of form retrieval in Elasticsearch.
- **[els-schema/src/test/java/io/camunda/tasklist/store/opensearch/FormStoreOpenSearchTest.java]**: New test cases are added to cover the different scenarios of form retrieval in OpenSearch.

## Definition of Done

Closes #3580 

## Description
* using Composite aggregation to get buckets from `bpmnProcessId` and `tenantId` terms sources, then add top hits aggregation to get the most recent version for each (`bpmnProcessId`, `tenantId`) couple as was suggested in https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/issues/3601#issuecomment-1754797354
* implemented for OS and ES

**Recommended test scenario:**
* deploy a process for different tenants with different versions
* do search process without providing tenantId in the request (I don't know if this can be triggered from UI, but it is supported by our internal controller)
* processes with highest version should be returned for each tenant

 esraagamal6: @houssain-barouni for OS with RBA enabled user is able to retrieve all processes regardless to the authorization permissions of the user
Steps:

1. Deploy a system with openSearch, RBA and MT enabled
2. Assigne demo user to <default> tenant group
3. create RBA for demo user to single process 
4. Open swagger and execute [/v1/internal/processes](http://localhost:8082/swagger-ui/index.html?urls.primaryName=internal-api#/Process/searchProcesses)

Expected result:
Only  the process with authorization to in step 3 is retrieved

Expected result:
All processed are retrieved

Same for [/v1/internal/processes/publicEndpoints](http://localhost:8082/swagger-ui/index.html?urls.primaryName=internal-api#/Process/getPublicEndpoints)
 houssain-barouni: > RBA enabled user is able to retrieve all processes

Good catch @esraagamal6 . It was not really related to this ticket but I fixed it anyway.

gitHubText:
Closes [#3601](https://github.com/camunda/tasklist/issues/3601) ## Description ES aggregation is used to fetch the most recent version process by tenantId/processId couple (required for multi-tenancy feature) However, by default, aggregation returns only 10 buckets. Meaning we are handling 10 results max. (1 item per bucket for top hits) Tweaking ES to return more buckets using aggregations size Long term fix would be using [Composite Aggregation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations-bucket-composite-aggregation.html) which is more efficient when used along with pagination. [Optimize](https://github.com/camunda/camunda-optimize/blob/845325834b0537aeb194c8878cf211c47b8d14db/backend/src/main/java/org/camunda/optimize/service/es/CompositeAggregationScroller.java) is already using that. Search processes does not provide pagination yet. Pagination will be implemented in another ticket after coordination with UX and FE ## Definition of Done _Not all items need to be done depending on the issue and the pull request._ - [x] All acceptance criteria described in the issue are met Testing: - [x] Unit/integration tests are written, that verify all acceptance criteria of the issue - [x] E2E tests are written, if the acceptance criteria can't be covered in unit/integration tests - [x] The fix/feature is tested manually by the author Documentation: - Fixes #2173 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

As described in the parent issue, this PR contains the initial changes required for the Azure AD implementation

### Is there anything else to consider?
<!-- As a suggestion, were any alternatives considered? Is there any particular decision you'd like to highlight? -->

As we have limited time for this first change I have just opted to create a new implementation that duplicates some code. In further iterations I would like to ideally create a "generic" set of classes and then have both Keycloak and Azure AD implementations extend from that. This way, in instances where possible we can cover authentication paths but where something more specific is needed we can extend and handle it as necessary.

- [x] Design review requested or not required

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Fixes #2121 

### Description
This PR adds code changes needed to connect to a [AWS Aurora database](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/?nc1=h_ls) using the [aws-advanced-jdbc-wrapper](https://github.com/awslabs/aws-advanced-jdbc-wrapper/tree/main) with [IAM plugin](https://github.com/awslabs/aws-advanced-jdbc-wrapper/blob/main/docs/using-the-jdbc-driver/using-plugins/UsingTheIamAuthenticationPlugin.md#how-do-i-use-iam-with-the-aws-advanced-jdbc-driver).

The solution is highly inspired by [the work done by the Web Modeler team](https://github.com/camunda/web-modeler/pull/4455/files).

### Is there anything else to consider?
I have tried running e2e tests with Aurora which turned out to be a bigger challenge because the AWS runners have certificates installed and specific env variables set to allow ssl communication with the Aurora database using IAM. I did not manage to successfully inject these into the Identity docker container.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] Code changes are covered by tests
- [x] Design review requested or not required


 dlavrenuek: You can see in [this run](https://github.com/camunda-cloud/identity/actions/runs/6695114101/job/18191414913) that the tests are executed successfully
 Ben-Sheppard: Seems like there are some test failures here, one being
```
Could not resolve placeholder 'spring.datasource.driver-class-name' in value "${spring.datasource.driver-class-name}"
```
Should that value be `${spring.datasource.driver-class-name:}` so there is a default value?
 dlavrenuek: Snyk has found a new Medium level vulnerability [CVE-2023-4586](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-4586) introduced by the new aws libraries: https://app.snyk.io/org/team-identity/project/a21f177d-2c09-4f89-96c2-4ef0236673c9/pr-check/ee1c8eea-43dc-41d0-af91-90417b7c1060

> Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation. Certificate hostname validation is disabled by default in Netty 4.1.x which makes it potentially susceptible to Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

According to this issue in Amazons' repository, certificate verification is enabled manually in the code, which makes the usage of the aws libraries not affected by this CVE
https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java-v2/issues/4584#issuecomment-1760547020
title: feat: add support for AWS Aurora database

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
N/A

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->
This change makes it so the implementation info is available inside MANIFEST.MF of the jar. This makes it easy to pull the Identity version that's being used in other project that depend on this SDK during runtime.

I made this change to improve the E2E testing in Zeebe. We spin up a container of the Identity SNAPSHOT. This ivery fault-sensitive as the SNAPSHOT could change at any time. It also becomes an issue when supporting older versions, as the old SDK might not align with the SNAPSHOT version. By adding this information we can easily get the version that we depend on during runtime and use this for Docker image in our E2E tests.

### Is there anything else to consider?
<!-- As a suggestion, were any alternatives considered? Is there any particular decision you'd like to highlight? -->

- [ ] Code changes are covered by tests
- [ ] Design review requested or not required

### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Closes #2159 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

To better support our internal teams and customers with automations, this PR introduces initializer updates to allow not only the creation of tenants, but also the ability to assign members to these tenants via configuration.

### Is there anything else to consider?
<!-- As a suggestion, were any alternatives considered? Is there any particular decision you'd like to highlight? -->

- The `<default>` tenant is something that should exist in the environment regardless of if other tenants are configured, in the existing structure the default tenant could have been overwritten and removed leading to an inconsistent state. I decided that moving the `<default>` tenant definition to a new section (`identity.environment`) protects against this somewhat and also denotes the importance of this tenant in the environment. I'm happy to discuss this approach though.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] Code changes are covered by tests
- [x] Design review requested or not required

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Closes #1973 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

This is described much better in the linked issue however this PR is the first step in enabling users with specific permissions to access the authorization data for an organization.

### Is there anything else to consider?
<!-- As a suggestion, were any alternatives considered? Is there any particular decision you'd like to highlight? -->

* I have made some tweaks to the SDK, the `permissions` claim is found on JWTs from Auth0 but it was being skipped in the SDK due to audience reasons. I couldn't think of another way around this, additionally I have updated the Keycloak implementation of the `getPermissions` method to return an empty list vs a NPE on an invalid token structure, semantically the result is the same IMO.
* In the context of retrieving all authorizations in an installation/organization it made sense to have the entity ID and type that the authorization relates to, I decided that instead of creating yet another representation to display the same data in a slightly different way, that its just easiest to add it to the existing responses.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] Code changes are covered by tests
- [x] Design review requested or not required

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Fixes #2264 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

As described in the linked issue, there appears to be a clashing of dependency versions for the jupiter artifacts, setting the versions via a `dependencyManagement` block doesn't seem to be successful (more exploration could be good here), so I have opted for a two fold approach:

1. Set the Jupiter versions to a version that works
2. Configure the maven failsafe plugin to fail the build if no tests are run during the verify stage for the management-api artifact.

The first point is clear, the second point is an extra layer of protection, we know that there are ITs that run during the validation phase in the `management-api` module so seeing no tests run is not expected (unless the tests are skipped using `-DskipTests=true` though the build is still successful in this instance.

### Is there anything else to consider?
<!-- As a suggestion, were any alternatives considered? Is there any particular decision you'd like to highlight? -->

I tried to think of different ways to work through the dependency clashes but they felt at best like I was sticking a plaster over things and not letting Maven use its built in logic for dependency resolution (by for example excluding the dependency from spring-boot-test` or forcing the version).

I believe that for now (and to get our builds back to a credible position) this change is sufficient.
title: fix: dependency issues causing tests to not run

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>spring-projects/spring-boot (org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter)</summary>

### [`v3.1.5`](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/releases/tag/v3.1.5)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/compare/v3.1.4...v3.1.5)

#### :warning: Noteworthy Changes

-   The behavior of `spring.jms.listener.concurrency` has been corrected to match the documentation ([#​37180](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/pull/37180)). If you were setting `spring.jms.listener.concurrency` without also setting `spring.jms.listener.max-concurrency`, please review your configuration when upgrading.

#### :lady_beetle: Bug Fixes

-   Constructor binding with a custom collection type does not work [#​37941](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37941)
-   `@Order` does not work on (CommandLine|Application)Runner `@Bean` methods [#​37938](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37938)
-   `@ComponentScan` on a test class is processed when creating a test context but is not included in the context's cache key [#​37924](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37924)
-   Restarter creates memory leak in tests [#​37920](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37920)
-   AOT processing fails when a `@WebServlet` found by scanning is annotated with `@MultipartConfig` [#​37883](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37883)
-   Gradle plugin uses to-be-deprecated API for getting and setting file permissions [#​37881](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37881)
-   Task executor metrics are not registered when using lazy initialization [#​37838](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37838)
-   Gradle AOT processing tasks do not use project's Java toolchain [#​37826](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37826)
-   `@ServiceConnection` is not found when used in an interface implemented by a test class [#​37671](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37671)
-   Image building can fail when using GraalVM compilation and a remote Docker daemon [#​37665](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37665)
-   NPE from Jetty's WebSocketUpgradeFilter when testing with `@SpringBootTest`, `@AutoConfigureMockMvc`, and MockMvc [#​37663](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37663)
-   `@WebListener` does not work in a native image without additional reflection hints [#​37635](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37635)
-   AspectJ transaction management with compile-time weaving does not work with spring.main.lazy-initialization=true [#​37632](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37632)
-   IPv6 IP addresses cannot be used with RabbitMQ [#​37619](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/pull/37619)
-   Unwanted Logback status messages are sometimes logged during startup [#​37600](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37600)
-   Managed types for Neo4j are not used in Neo4j Data auto configuration [#​37594](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37594)
-   fileMode and dirMode are not applied to all entries in an archive produced by BootJar [#​37588](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37588)
-   Application fails to start when an optional config import cannot be resolved [#​37570](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37570)
-   Contrary to the documentation, setting spring.jms.listener.concurrency alone configures the maximum concurrency [#​37553](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37553)
-   Dependency management for kafka-server-common with a test classifier is missing [#​37542](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37542)
-   RepackageMojo doesn't support 1 digit numerical values for project.build.outputTimestamp [#​37535](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37535)

#### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

-   Document that 'spring.docker.compose.file' can be used to share Docker Compose configuration between applications [#​37886](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37886)
-   Remove link to LiveReload website due to timeout [#​37691](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37691)
-   Refer to ActiveMQ as ActiveMQ "Classic" [#​37615](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37615)
-   Removal of spring.webflux.multipart.streaming is not documented [#​37609](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37609)
-   Default value of spring.jmx.registration-policy is not documented [#​37596](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37596)
-   Update documentation to align with Mockito 5 using the inline mock maker by default [#​37561](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/pull/37561)
-   Add Javadoc since for AbstractAotMojo.getSession() [#​37547](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37547)
-   Document support for Java 21 [#​37532](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37532)
-   Use more idiomatic Kotlin in example for "Map Health Indicators to Micrometer Metrics" [#​37510](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37510)

#### :hammer: Dependency Upgrades

-   Upgrade to Byte Buddy 1.14.9 [#​37853](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37853)
-   Upgrade to Couchbase Client 3.4.11 [#​37759](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37759)
-   Upgrade to Dropwizard Metrics 4.2.21 [#​37897](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37897)
-   Upgrade to Hibernate 6.2.13.Final [#​37854](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37854)
-   Upgrade to HttpCore5 5.2.3 [#​37762](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37762)
-   Upgrade to Infinispan 14.0.19.Final [#​37855](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37855)
-   Upgrade to Jackson Bom 2.15.3 [#​37898](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37898)
-   Upgrade to Jetty 11.0.17 [#​37856](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37856)
-   Upgrade to Jetty Reactive HTTPClient 3.0.9 [#​37932](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37932)
-   Upgrade to jOOQ 3.18.7 [#​37857](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37857)
-   Upgrade to Micrometer 1.11.5 [#​37693](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37693)
-   Upgrade to Micrometer Tracing 1.1.6 [#​37694](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37694)
-   Upgrade to Neo4j Java Driver 5.13.0 [#​37793](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37793)
-   Upgrade to Netty 4.1.100.Final [#​37858](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37858)
-   Upgrade to Pooled JMS 3.1.4 [#​37764](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37764)
-   Upgrade to R2DBC MySQL 1.0.5 [#​37859](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37859)
-   Upgrade to Reactor Bom 2022.0.12 [#​37695](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37695)
-   Upgrade to RxJava3 3.1.8 [#​37766](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37766)
-   Upgrade to Spring AMQP 3.0.10 [#​37696](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37696)
-   Upgrade to Spring Authorization Server 1.1.3 [#​37697](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37697)
-   Upgrade to Spring Data Bom 2023.0.5 [#​37698](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37698)
-   Upgrade to Spring Framework 6.0.13 [#​37816](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37816)
-   Upgrade to Spring Integration 6.1.4 [#​37914](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37914)
-   Upgrade to Spring Kafka 3.0.12 [#​37797](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37797)
-   Upgrade to Spring LDAP 3.1.2 [#​37699](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37699)

-   Upgrade to Tomcat 10.1.15 [#​37902](https://togithub.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/37902)

### Related issue(s)
related to https://github.com/camunda-cloud/identity/pull/2184


### Description
In #2184 I have added artifact deployment for the new `-starter` and `-autoconfigure` artifacts, however this step fails due to being executed with Java 11 instead of Java 17 (see https://github.com/camunda-cloud/identity/actions/runs/6615156752/job/17966714643)

gitHubText:
### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

I noticed whilst putting together an example set of configuration for tenants that currently there is a exception when trying to assign members in configuration, which is:
```
Caused by: org.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: failed to lazily initialize a collection of role: io.camunda.identity.entity.AccessRule.tenants: could not initialize proxy - no Session
```

Looking at it I can see that the code fails when we try to retrieve the tenants for the access rule that we want to assign a member to, frustratingly we have tests for this behaviour but it seems that the Hibernate session is extending to allow the tests to pass...

Having [read a little about the options to resolve this](https://www.baeldung.com/hibernate-initialize-proxy-exception) I decided to opt for the `JOIN FETCH` approach as mentioned [here](https://www.baeldung.com/hibernate-initialize-proxy-exception#4-using-join-fetching) because using `FetchType.EAGER` is generally discouraged.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] Code changes are covered by tests
- [x] Design review requested or not required


 Infra-connect: Successfully created backport PR for `v8.3`:
- #2183

title: fix: fix for 2 vulnerabilities

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Fixes #1979 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

It seems that with our current configuration, the Log4J2 system was proactively creating the file. This is producing the undesirable result and it turns out there is a property to toggle this feature ([REF](https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/manual/appenders.html#fileappender)).


 Infra-connect: Successfully created backport PR for `v8.2`:
- #2167
 Infra-connect: Successfully created backport PR for `v8.3`:
- #2168
title: fix: only create log file when required

gitHubText:
### Related issue(s)
<!-- Changes should have a linked issue for traceability, use closing words such as "Closes" or "Fixes" to automatically handle related issue status. -->
Fixes #2152 

### Description
<!-- Consider suggesting why this change is being made, for example has an issue been spotted? Have we found a more performant way to solve the problem? -->

As described in the linked issue, the `/tenants` page was failing to load due to the serviceWorker setting a body for `GET` calls. This PR changes the logic to avoid doing this specifically for `GET`

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Code changes are covered by tests
- [ ] Design review requested or not required


 Infra-connect: Successfully created backport PR for `v8.3`:
- #2156
title: fix: prevent body on GET call in serviceWorker
